llm.feedback: Your movers‑and‑scenarios block is structurally correct but tighten the formatting: keep each field separated by a single “|”, place the (ID) citation immediately after the element it supports, and ensure the probability is a plain “55%” (no extra parentheses). For the swing‑trade line, replace the current placeholder with a single, fully‑specified line that follows the required schema: Direction | Horizon | Entry | Stop | Target | R/R | Invalidation | Trigger | Probability % | Confidence 0‑100. Use the only price data in the source – current $451 and fair‑value $483 – so the line should read, for example: Up | 1‑2 months | $451 (KNWKYIQ1W) | $440 (KNWKYIQ1W) | $483 (KNWKYIQ1W) | 1:1 (KNWKYIQ1W) | Q3 earnings miss (KNWKYIQ1W) | Q3 earnings beat (KNWKYIQ1W) | 55% (KNWKYIQ1W) | 70 (KNWKYIQ1W). Remove all meta‑commentary (“Main‑focus check”, “The draft MUST…”) and any extraneous text; keep only the five lines of market logic, each with its inline citation. This will satisfy the format, source‑only constraint, and provide a clear, actionable swing‑trade plan.
